Posts.Content: Holly1970 wrote: My doctor wants me to see a Cancer Prevention specialist to start taking Tamoxifen as she thinks I could developed breast cancer with in the next five years.  My mother and one of her sisters, 2 great aunts (all maternal) have passed away from breast cancer.  One of her sisters is a survivor.  My grandmother, (maternal), has ovarian cancer now.  I have had several abnormal mamo's and had to go back for repeats and gamma grams but they continue to tell me that things are looking ok....my mother had a mamo 6 weeks prior to finding out she had stage III inflammatory breast cancer.  I am already anemic and take Iron Injections once a week for 8 weeks every year. I have 4 children and have had a hysterectomy to help keep my iron levels up. What I would like to know...if there is anyone who has taken Tamoxifen as prevention before cancer is diagnosed?   How long they took it?  Do you loose your hair?     What other options do I have?  Thanks for any information anyone can share.  Holly Log in to post a reply
